intro: Gomphia mannii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a slender, branching stem and produces small, woody pods that contain seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland and savanna habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
